administrator_protection_is_enabled: Administrator Protection is enabled, some features may not work properly. Please disable Administrator Protection and restart Windows to continue.

contributors_name: GuCATs, ArcticFoxPro, LuYang114, zwJimRaynor (Icon Design) and Other Community Volunteers
get_more_contact_from_official_website: Please get more contact information from the 'More Contact' section at the bottom of the official website.
privacy_policy_content:
MSPCManagerHelper (hereinafter referred to as "the Software") does not collect or upload any data in any form, including but not limited to computer identifiers, geographic information, etc. All data collection while using the Software is performed by Microsoft® Windows® Operating System and software such as Microsoft PC Manager.

MSPCManagerHelper has the "Support Developer" option checked by default. This option will add the "Microsoft Student Ambassadors" tracking code when you visit certain Microsoft links (e.g., learn.microsoft.com/?wt.mc_id=studentamb_265231) to help developers track visitor traffic. All tracking services will be performed by Microsoft when you visit the relevant websites.
terms_of_use_content:
Welcome to MSPCManagerHelper (hereinafter referred to as "the Software"). Please carefully read the following terms of use (hereinafter referred to as "the Terms") before using the Software. By downloading, installing, or using the Software, you agree to comply with these Terms. If you do not agree with these Terms, please do not use the Software. Terms are subject to change without notice.

Terms Modification Date: December 22, 2024

1. License to Use
The Software is licensed to you by individual developer GuCATs (hereinafter referred to as "the Developer") for personal, non-commercial use only. You may not copy, modify, distribute, sell, or lease any part of the Software without the Developer's written permission.

2. Intellectual Property
The Software and all its content (including but not limited to text, images, icons, interfaces, code, and trademarks) are protected by copyright laws and other intellectual property laws. The Developer reserves all rights not expressly granted.

3. User Responsibility
You agree to comply with all applicable laws and regulations while using the Software. You may not use the Software for any illegal activities or infringe upon the rights of others.

4. Privacy Policy
The Developer respects your privacy and is committed to protecting your personal information. For detailed information on how we collect, use, and protect your information, please refer to our [Privacy Policy].

5. Disclaimer
The Software is provided "as is" without any express or implied warranties, including but not limited to warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and non-infringement. The Developer does not guarantee that the functions of the Software will meet your requirements or that the operation of the Software will be uninterrupted or error-free. The Developer is not responsible for any issues arising from the use of the Software.

6. Limitation of Liability
To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, the Developer shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages resulting from the use or inability to use the Software, even if the Developer has been advised of the possibility of such damages.

7. Modification of Terms
The Developer reserves the right to modify these Terms at any time. The modified Terms will take effect immediately upon being posted in the Software or on the Developer's website. Your continued use of the Software signifies your acceptance of the modified Terms.

8. Termination
If you violate these Terms, the Developer reserves the right to immediately terminate your license to use the Software without prior notice.

9. Governing Law
These Terms are governed by the laws of [Country/Region], without regard to its conflict of law principles.

10. Open Source License
The Software uses the MIT open-source license. You can view the details at [MIT License](https://github.com/Goo-aw233/MSPCManagerHelper/blob/main/LICENSE.txt).

11. Third-Party Software
[NSudo](https://github.com/M2TeamArchived/NSudo).

welcome_message: Welcome to MSPCManagerHelper! This tool is designed to help you manage Microsoft PC Manager. Please select a feature from the navigation menu to continue. Please read the "Terms of Use" and "Privacy Policy" before using MSPCManagerHelper. By continuing to use, you agree to these terms.
install_microsoft_edge_webview2_runtime_: Install the Microsoft Edge WebView2 Runtime required for Microsoft PC Manager to run.
install_via_appxmanifest: Install Microsoft PC Manager from AppxManifest.xml
install_via_appxmanifest_description: Install Microsoft PC Manager from AppxManifest.xml to bypass the minimum installation requirements for Microsoft PC Manager.
install_via_dism_for_all_users: Install Microsoft PC Manager for All Users via DISM
install_via_dism_for_all_users_descripti: Install Microsoft PC Manager provisioning package for all users using DISM.

install_via_powershell_for_current_user_: Install Microsoft PC Manager for the current user only.
install_via_winget: Install Microsoft PC Manager from WinGet (msstore source)
install_via_winget_description: Install Microsoft PC Manager via the msstore source on WinGet.
reinstall_via_powershell_description: Reinstall Microsoft PC Manager using PowerShell without selecting an application package.
update_via_application_package: Update Microsoft PC Manager from Application Package
update_via_application_package_descripti: Update Microsoft PC Manager for all users from the application package.

Downloading Microsoft PC Manager from WinGet...
Download time depends on your network connection, please be patient.

The Microsoft Edge WebView2 Runtime installer needs to run as Administrator.
microsoft_pc_manager_installed_successfu: Microsoft PC Manager has been installed successfully.
microsoft_store_page_opened_in_browser:
The Microsoft PC Manager Microsoft Store page has been opened.
Microsoft Store is not yet installed, you can download and reset the Microsoft Store online by `wsreset.exe -i`. Or get the Microsoft PC Manager installer at https://get.microsoft.com/installer/download/9PM860492SZD.

whether_agree_with_the_msstore_source_ag:
The `msstore` source requires that you view the following agreements before using. 
Terms of Transaction: https://aka.ms/microsoft-store-terms-of-transaction 
The source requires the current machine's 2-letter geographic region to be sent to the backend service to function properly (ex. 'US').
winget_not_internet_connection: Unable to connect to the Internet. Please check the Internet connection and retry.
winget_no_results_found: No package found matching input criteria.
winget_is_not_installed:
WinGet is not installed yet, please use another solution.
You can download and install Windows Package Manager via Microsoft Learn (https://learn.microsoft.com/windows/msix/app-installer/install-update-app-installer/?wt.mc_id=studentamb_265231) or GitHub (https://github.com/microsoft/winget-cli/releases) and retry after downloading and installing Windows Package Manager.
winget_source_reset_needed: Failed when opening source(s); try the 'winget.exe source reset --force' command if the problem persists.
microsoft_pc_manager_logs_collection_des: Collect Microsoft PC Manager log files and related log files and information from this computer for analysis.

uninstall_microsoft_pc_manager_beta_desc:
Uninstall Microsoft PC Manager Beta and clean up all related registry items and residual files.
Microsoft PC Manager Beta has ended support, thank you for your testing, please install Microsoft PC Manager from the Microsoft Store.
